AuthenticationMthd.description: iSCSI Boot authentication method configuration values.

enumDescriptions.CHAP: iSCSI Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) authentication is used.
enumDescriptions.MutualCHAP: iSCSI Mutual Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) authentication is used.

BtMode.description: Network device boot mode configuration values.

enumDescriptions.Disabled: Do not indicate to UEFI/BIOS that this device is bootable.
enumDescriptions.FibreChannel: Boot this device using the embedded Fibre Channel support and configuration.  Only applicable if the NetworkDeviceFunctionType is set to FibreChannel.
enumDescriptions.FibreChannelOverEthernet: Boot this device using the embedded Fibre Channel over Ethernet (FCoE) boot support and configuration.  Only applicable if the NetworkDeviceFunctionType is set to FibreChannelOverEthernet.
enumDescriptions.PXE: Boot this device using the embedded PXE support.  Only applicable if the NetworkDeviceFunctionType is set to Ethernet. Not supported by HPE.
enumDescriptions.iSCSI: Boot this device using the embedded iSCSI boot support and configuration.  Only applicable if the NetworkDeviceFunctionType is set to iSCSI.

BootPriority.description: The relative priority for this entry in the boot targets array.  Lower numbers shall represent higher priority, with zero being the highest priority.  The BootPriority shall be unique for all entries of the BootTargets array.

LUNID.description: The Logical Unit Number (LUN) ID to boot from on the device referred to by the corresponding WWPN.

WWPN.description: The value of this property shall be World-Wide Port Name (WWPN) to boot from.

MACAddress.description: The effective current MAC Address of this network device function. If an assignable MAC address is not supported, this is a read only alias of the PermanentMACAddress.

MTUSize.description: The Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) configured for this Network Device Function.  This value serves as a default for the OS driver when booting.  The value only takes-effect on boot.

PermanentMACAddress.description: The Permanent MAC Address of this network device function (physical function). This value is typically programmed during the manufacturing time. This address is not assignable.

AllowFIPVLANDiscovery.description: For FCoE connections, a boolean indicating whether the FIP VLAN Discovery Protocol is used to determine the FCoE VLAN ID selected by the network device function for the FCoE connection.  If true, and the FIP VLAN Discovery succeeds, the FCoEActiveVLANId property shall reflect the FCoE VLAN ID to be used for all FCoE traffic.  If false, or if the FIP VLAN Discovery protocol fails, the FCoELocalVLANId shall be used for all FCoE traffic and the FCoEActiveVLANId shall reflect the FCoELocalVLANId.

BootTargets.description: An array of Fibre Channel boot targets configured for this network device function.

FCoEActiveVLANId.description: For FCoE connections, the value of this property shall be null or a VLAN ID currently being used for FCoE traffic.  When the FCoE link is down this value shall be null.  When the FCoE link is up this value shall be either the FCoELocalVLANId property or a VLAN discovered via the FIP protocol.

FCoELocalVLANId.description: For FCoE connections, the locally configured VLAN ID.  This value shall be used for FCoE traffic to this network device function during boot unless AllowFIPVLANDiscovery is true and a valid FCoE VLAN ID is found via the FIP VLAN Discovery Protocol.

PermanentWWNN.description: The permanent World-Wide Node Name (WWNN) of this network device function (physical function). This value is typically programmed during the manufacturing time. This address is not assignable.

PermanentWWPN.longDescription: The permanent World-Wide Port Name (WWPN) of this network device function (physical function). This value is typically programmed during the manufacturing time. This address is not assignable.

WWNN.description: The value of this property shall be the effective current World-Wide Node Name (WWNN) of this network device function (physical function). If an assignable WWNN is not supported, this is a read only alias of the PermanentWWNN.

WWNSource.description: The configuration source of the WWNs for this connection (WWPN and WWNN).

WWPN.description: The effective current World-Wide Port Name (WWPN) of this network device function (physical function). If an assignable WWPN is not supported, this is a read only alias of the PermanentWWPN.

enumDescriptions.IPv4: IPv4 addressing is used for all IP-fields in this object.
enumDescriptions.IPv6: IPv6 addressing is used for all IP-fields in this object.

AuthenticationMethod.description: The iSCSI boot authentication method for this network device function.

CHAPSecret.description: The shared secret for CHAP authentication. Must be 0, 12, or 16 characters in length.

IPAddressType.description: The type of IP address (IPv6 or IPv4) being populated in the iSCSIBoot IP address fields.  Mixing of IPv6 and IPv4 addresses on the same network device function is not allowed.

IPMaskDNSViaDHCP.description: When true, the iSCSI boot initiator will use DHCP to obtain the iniator name, IP address, and netmask.

InitiatorDefaultGateway.description: The IPv6 or IPv4 iSCSI boot default gateway.

InitiatorIPAddress.description: The IPv6 or IPv4 address of the iSCSI boot initiator.

InitiatorNetmask.description: The IPv6 or IPv4 netmask of the iSCSI boot initiator.

MutualCHAPSecret.description: The CHAP secret for 2-way CHAP authentication. Must be 0, 12, or 16 characters in length.

MutualCHAPUsername.description: The CHAP username for 2-way CHAP authentication.

PrimaryDNS.description: The IPv6 or IPv4 address of the primary DNS server for the iSCSI boot initiator.

PrimaryLUN.description: The logical unit number (LUN) for the primary iSCSI boot target.

PrimaryTargetIPAddress.description: The IP address (IPv6 or IPv4) for the primary iSCSI boot target.

PrimaryTargetName.description: The name of the primary iSCSI boot target, iSCSI Qualified Name (IQN).

PrimaryTargetTCPPort.description: The TCP port for the primary iSCSI boot target.

PrimaryVLANEnable.description: This indicates if the primary VLAN is enabled.  Not supported by HPE.

PrimaryVLANId.description: The 802.1q VLAN ID to use for iSCSI boot for both the primary and secondary targets.  Assign null value to disable.

RouterAdvertisementEnabled.description: A boolean indicating whether IPv6 router advertisement is enabled for the iSCSI boot target.  This setting shall only apply to IPv6 configurations.

SecondaryDNS.description: The value of this property shall be the IPv6 or IPv4 address of the secondary DNS server for the iSCSI boot initiator.

SecondaryLUN.description: The logical unit number (LUN) for the secondary iSCSI boot target.  Not supported by HPE.

SecondaryTargetIPAddress.description: The IP address (IPv6 or IPv4) for the secondary iSCSI boot target.

SecondaryTargetName.description: The name of the iSCSI secondary boot target, iSCSI Qualified Name (IQN).  Not supported by HPE. The value from PrimaryTargetName will be used for the secondary iSCSI boot target if configured.

SecondaryTargetTCPPort.description: The TCP port for the secondary iSCSI boot target.

SecondaryVLANEnable.description: This indicates if the secondary VLAN is enabled.  Not supported by HPE.

SecondaryVLANId.description: The 802.1q VLAN ID to use for iSCSI boot from the secondary target.  Not supported by HPE.

TargetInfoViaDHCP.description: When true indicates the iSCSI boot target name, LUN, IP address, and netmask should be obtained from DHCP.

enumDescriptions.ConfiguredLocally: The set of FC/FCoE boot targets was applied locally through API or UI.
enumDescriptions.ProvidedByFabric: The set of FC/FCoE boot targets was applied by the Fibre Channel fabric.

description: A Network Device Function represents a logical interface exposed by the network adapter.

AssignablePhysicalPorts.description: An array of references to the physical ports which may be assigned to this network device function.

BootMode.description: The boot mode configured for this network device function.

DeviceEnabled.description: A boolean indicating whether the network device function is enabled. Disabled network device functions shall not be enumerated or seen by the operating system.

Ethernet.description: This object contains Ethernet capabilities, status, and configuration values for this network device function.

FibreChannel.description: This object contains Fibre Channel capabilities, status, and configuration values for this network device function.

PCIeFunction.description: Contains the members of this collection.

PhysicalPortAssignment.description: A reference to the physical port currently assigned to this network device function.

MaxVirtualFunctions.description: The number of virtual functions (VFs) availbale for this network device function.

NetDevFuncCapabilities.description: An array listing the available capabilities of this network device function.

enumDescriptions.Disabled: Neither enumerated nor visible to the operating system.
enumDescriptions.Ethernet: Appears to the operating system as an Ethernet device.
enumDescriptions.FibreChannel: Appears to the operating system as a Fibre Channel device.
enumDescriptions.FibreChannelOverEthernet: Appears to the operating system as an FCoE device.
enumDescriptions.iSCSI: Appears to the operating system as an iSCSI device.

NetDevFuncType.description: The configured capability of this network device function.

enumDescriptions.Disabled: Neither enumerated nor visible to the operating system.
enumDescriptions.Ethernet: Appears to the operating system as an Ethernet device.
enumDescriptions.FibreChannel: Appears to the operating system as a Fibre Channel device.
enumDescriptions.FibreChannelOverEthernet: Appears to the operating system as an FCoE device.
enumDescriptions.iSCSI: Appears to the operating system as an iSCSI device.

PhysicalPortAssignment.deprecated: This property has been deprecated and moved to the Links section to avoid loops on expand.
PhysicalPortAssignment.description: A reference to the physical port currently assigned to this network device function.

Settings.description: The Settings object returns currently pending configuration changes on GET, and is used to initiate configuration changes via PATCH.

VirtualFunctionsEnabled.description: Indicates whether Single Root I/O Virtualization (SR-IOV) Virual Functions (VFs) are enabled for this network device function.

iSCSIBoot.description: This object contains iSCSI boot capabilities, status, and configuration values for this network device function.

title: #NetworkDeviceFunction.v1_3_0.NetworkDeviceFunction
